thread.title: Alligator prevents family from entering the sea on Texas beach
thread.title_full: Alligator prevents family from entering the sea on Texas beach | Daily Mail Online

author: Jake Polden For Mailonline
title: Alligator prevents family from entering the sea on Texas beach
text:
9 shares 4
View
comments
An alligator disrupted a family holiday when it swam close to the shoreline and prevented them from entering the sea.
Ray McGee and his family visited Bryan Beach in Freeport, Texas, to do some surf fishing but their trip was cut short by the sight of the large reptile.
Captured on video, the alligator can be seen resting in the water around 120 feet from the family, who film it as it begins traversing the shoreline.
Gator-crasher! Alligator ruins families fishing holiday That's not a fish! Ray McGee and his family visited Bryan Beach in Freeport, Texas, to do some surf fishing
The family voice their concern and one shocked member says: ‘We need to call somebody. We definitely need to call somebody.’
 Next Incredible moment THREE-MONTH-old baby boy stuns his parents... Smoke and fire emerges from the ground as manhole EXPLODES... Was that a deer or the sound of a squeaky door closing?... Camera operator attaches coat hangers to drone to carry out... They then speculate that there could be another alligator in the water before a woman suggests calling the police.
Later in the video the alligator looks over towards the family and they comment on the fact that it appears to be staring at them.
The alligator sat in the water around 120 feet from the family, who filmed it as it began traversing the shoreline
The large alligator patrolled the shoreline in one direction before turning around and swimming the other way
A woman suggested calling the police and later in the video the alligator looked over at the family
The large alligator then turns around and begins patrolling the shoreline in the other direction before turning back the other way and continuing on its original path.
Unlike most species of crocodile, which have glands in their mouths to expel salt from their systems, alligators do not.
They can tolerate salt water for short periods however but need to return to fresh water regularly to rinse out their systems.
